dcterms:creator: S. Shao
S. McAleer
R. Yan
P. Baldi
dcterms:description: The SEU gearbox dataset is collected from the Drivetrain Dynamic Simulator and contains two kinds of working states with rotating speeds: 20Hz and 30Hz. It includes five kinds of gearbox faults in each working state, including chipped tooth, missing tooth, root fault, surface fault, and healthy working state, divided into ten data files. Each file contains eight columns of vibration signals, with the third column indicating the vibration signal of the planetary gearbox in the Z-orientation, sampled at 2000Hz.
dcterms:title: Southeast University (SEU) gearbox dataset

dcterms:creator: P. Cao
S. Zhang
J. Tang
dcterms:description: The UoC gear fault dataset records nine different gear fault types, including missing tooth, root crack, healthy state, spalling fault, and chipping tip with five different levels of severity. The dataset was sampled at 20 kHz, and for this experiment, chipping tips with two typical severity levels, chip1a and chip2a, were used.
dcterms:title: University of Connecticut (UoC) gear fault dataset
